channel.title: e3 2009
channel.description:
Damn I think MS won this year although sony was impressive too.
as always nintendo was shit.
http://www.engadget.com/2009/06/02/engadget-and-joystiq-live-from-sonys-e3-2009-keynote/ http://www.engadget.com/2009/06/02/engadget-and-joystiq-live-from-nintendos-e3-2009-keynote/ http://www.engadget.com/2009/06/01/engadget-and-joystiq-live-from-microsofts-e3-2009-keynote/

item.title: e3 2009
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Square:

Nintendo didn’t have much to offer other than a new Mario… What a surprise.

You forgot about the best fucking game on the e3 (at least, at nintendo’s stand), which is, golden mofoing sun 3

Read full topic

item.title: e3 2009
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Hardly any exclusive content coming to the playstation? Lol’d.

Honestly, Sony own 22 of their own internal studios that have pumped out some of the best games this generation that microsofts crap hasn’t touched so far. Microsoft have 4 of their own internal studios, they have little exclusives to their console.

I’m pissed off at microsoft again, they had a good show but that is just it, it was just a show - no real substance. They shown nothing decent with the exception of splintercell conviction, i want games to play on my xbox - but they’re not giving me any, what a waste of fucking money this xbox was again.

Oh and lol at developing new technology, i still wonder why MS are using middleware engines such as the unreal engine for their best games while sony has their internal studio’s create all new engines specifically for each game they make and that reflects in the actual games themselfs.

And that emotion “milo” shit is all software, not hardware whoever asked if the PS Eye is possible of that, because it is. Sony had this sort of stuff demoing back in 2006 and 2007.

Read full topic

item.title: e3 2009
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Frostie21:

I just skimmed through most of those but it seems,MGS for 360 too?

Not the end of the world, it isn’t MGS5 and definitely not MGS4, and it looks like this multi-console release is more action orientated.

goatee:

I really think Sony are losing it, they have hardly any exclusive content coming to the PlayStation, whereas Xbox now has every major game series under their belt and our developing new technology all the time. Even Nintendo isn’t bad because revenue generated from the sale of Wii games can help games publishers produce bigger and better games.

What? Did you not see the PS3 link?

Read full topic

item.title: e3 2009
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Microsoft are a great company who, by keeping up the pressure, are encouraging growth in the gaming industry. The can only be a positive thing.

I really think Sony are losing it, they have hardly any exclusive content coming to the PlayStation, whereas Xbox now has every major game series under their belt and our developing new technology all the time. Even Nintendo isn’t bad because revenue generated from the sale of Wii games can help games publishers produce bigger and better games.

@Sanga, think about where we would be today without Microsoft, I highly doubt apple would have come about without them, so you can’t just say there would be an alternative company.

Read full topic

item.title: e3 2009
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:11, topic:281856”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=372470.msg2811615#msg2811615 date=1244041862]

If all the stuff Microsoft showed is going into the Xbox360, the 360 vs PS3 competition will be all over, and the PS3 will get ass raped by the xbox.

I don’t see how, the only thing that looks any good is the Natal thing, which still isn’t enough to make me want to buy a 360. Oh, Twitter and Facebook have been on the Wii and PS3 since their browsers have been available.

@Sanga,you complain about everything that microsoft does.

because they do everything wrong
[/quote]

It’s hilarious because if Microsoft was a British company you would love them. Truth.[/quote]
so you think i hate microsoft because they are American? If they were from any other country that wouldnt change my feelings about them as a company even if they were english. I dont despise everything to come from america otherwise i would hate CoD4 (I didn’t play the earlier incarnations of the series and i hated 5 anyway.) I would also hate the dell laptop i am using and in fact would hate a great deal many things from within my house that are from America, or at least made by american companies. Regardless of their nationality microsoft are shit they could be from fucking mars and i still wouldnt bat an eyelid. So next time before you go ahead making wild accusations actually use that raisin you call a brain and think first.

Read full topic

item.title: e3 2009
item.dc:creator: @soul_raever soul raever
item.description:
@soul_raever wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:8, topic:281856”][quote author=Niall link=topic=372470.msg2811398#msg2811398 date=1244019632]

If all the stuff Microsoft showed is going into the Xbox360, the 360 vs PS3 competition will be all over, and the PS3 will get ass raped by the xbox.

I don’t see how, the only thing that looks any good is the Natal thing, which still isn’t enough to make me want to buy a 360. Oh, Twitter and Facebook have been on the Wii and PS3 since their browsers have been available.
[/quote]
natal is a jumped up eyetoy. Wish microsoft could get their own ideas for a change[/quote]

emotional response is more than the eyetoy could ever be
acctually most of natal was completely impossible on an eyetoy an eytoy was just a camera…
the software was what made the eyetoy do anything of note

Read full topic
